017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
022
023import java.util.Optional;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Supplier;
027
028import org.apiguardian.api.API;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.LazyImpl;
031
032/**
033 *  <p>{@summary A holder for a lazy initialised object instance.}</p>
034 *  <p>An instance of an implementation of this interface holds a value that
035 *  will be initialised by a call to the supplier (provided with the method
036 *  {@link #use(Supplier)})
037 *  on a first call to
038 *  {@link #get()}.</p>
039 *  <p>The methods
040 *  {@link #getAsString()}
041 *  and
042 *  {@link #getAsString(Stringer)}
043 *  do call {@code get()} internally.</p>
044 *  <p>For special purposes, the method
045 *  {@link #of(Object)}
046 *  creates an already initialised instance of {@code Lazy}.</p>
047 *  <p>Use
048 *  {@link #isPresent()}
049 *  to avoid unnecessary initialisation.</p>
050 *  <p>As a lazy initialisation makes the value unpredictable, it is necessary
051 *  that the implementations of
052 *  {@link #equals(Object)}
053 *  and
054 *  {@link #hashCode()}
055 *  do force the initialisation.</p>
056 *  <p>{@link #toString()}
057 *  will not force the initialisation.</p>
058 *  <p>This interface is not feasible for the lazy initialisation of
059 *  connections to resources of any kind, as these will usually throw (checked)
060 *  exceptions when problems arise, and usually these should be handled on one
061 *  central location.</p>
062 *
063 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
064 *  @version $Id: Lazy.java 992 2022-01-16 19:51:31Z tquadrat $
065 *  @since 0.0.5
066 *
067 *  @UMLGraph.link
068 *
069 *  @param  <T> The type of the value for this instance of {@code Lazy}.
070 */
071@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Lazy.java 992 2022-01-16 19:51:31Z tquadrat $" )
072@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
073public sealed interface Lazy<T>
074    permits org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.LazyImpl
075{
076        /*---------*\
077    ====** Methods **==========================================================
078        \*---------*/
079    /**
080     *  {@inheritDoc}
081     */
082    @Override
083    public boolean equals( final Object obj );
084
085    /**
086     *  Returns the value for this instance of {@code Lazy}.
087     *
088     *  @return The value.
089     */
090    public T get();
091
092    /**
093     *  Returns the value for this instance of {@code Lazy} as its String
094     *  representation.<br>
095     *  <br>Basically it will call the value's
096     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
097     *  method.
098     *
099     *  @return The value as String.
100     */
101    public default String getAsString() { return getAsString( Objects::toString ); }
102
103    /**
104     *  Returns the value for this instance of {@code Lazy} as a String that is
105     *  generated by the provided
106     *  {@link Stringer}.
107     *
108     *  @note As the value is allowed to be {@code null}, it is necessary that
109     *      the provided instance of {@code Function} can handle {@code null}
110     *      as a valid argument.
111     *
112     *  @param  stringer    The function that creates the String from the
113     *      value.
114     *  @return The value as String.
115     */
116    public default String getAsString( final Stringer<? super T> stringer )
117    {
118        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( get() );
119
120        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
121        return retValue;
122    }   //  getAsString()
123
124    /**
125     *  {@inheritDoc}
126     */
127    @Override
128    public int hashCode();
129
130    /**
131     *  If this {@code Lazy} instance has been initialised already, the
132     *  provided
133     *  {@link Consumer}
134     *  will be executed; otherwise nothing happens.
135     *
136     *  @param  consumer    The consumer.
137     */
138    public default void ifPresent( final Consumer<? super T> consumer )
139    {
140        if( isPresent() ) requireNonNullArgument( consumer, "consumer" ).accept( get() );
141    }   //  ifPresent()
142
143    /**
144     *  Checks whether this {@code Lazy} instance has been initialised already.
145     *  But even it was initialised,
146     *  {@link #get()}
147     *  may still return {@code null}.
148     *
149     *  @return {@code true} if the instance was initialised, {@code false}
150     *      otherwise.
151     */
152    public boolean isPresent();
153
154    /**
155     *  If this instance of {@code Lazy} is initialised, the provided mapper
156     *  function will be executed on the value.
157     *
158     *  @param  <R> The result type for the mapper function.
159     *  @param  mapper  The mapper function.
160     *  @return An instance of
161     *      {@link Optional}
162     *      that holds the result for the mapping.
163     */
164    public default <R> Optional<R> map( final Function<? super T,? extends R> mapper )
165    {
166        final Optional<R> retValue = isPresent() ? Optional.ofNullable( mapper.apply( get() ) ) : Optional.empty();
167
168        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
169        return retValue;
170    }   //  map()
171
172    /**
173     *  Creates a new {@code Lazy} instance that is already initialised.<br>
174     *  <br>This allows to use {@code Lazy} instances also for
175     *  {@linkplain java.lang.Cloneable cloneable}
176     *  objects, given that {@code T} is either cloneable itself or
177     *  immutable.
178     *
179     *  @param  <T> The type of the value for the new instance of {@code Lazy}.
180     *  @param  value   The value; can be {@code null}.
181     *  @return The new instance.
182     *
183     *  @see Object#clone()
184     */
185    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
186    public static <T> Lazy<T> of( final T value )
187    {
188        return new LazyImpl<>( value );
189    }   //  of()
190
191    /**
192     *  Returns the value or throws the exception that is created by the
193     *  given
194     *  {@link Supplier}
195     *  when not yet initialised.
196     *
197     *  @param  <X> The type of the implementation of
198     *      {@link Throwable}.
199     *  @param  exceptionSupplier   The supplier for the exception to throw
200     *      when the instance was not yet initialised.
201     *  @return The value.
202     *  @throws X   When not initialised, the exception created by the given
203     *      supplier will be thrown.
204     */
205    public <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow( Supplier<? extends X> exceptionSupplier ) throws X;
206
207    /**
208     *  {@inheritDoc}
209     */
210    @Override
211    public String toString();
212
213    /**
214     *  Creates a new {@code Lazy} instance that uses the given supplier to
215     *  initialise.
216     *
217     *  @param  <T> The type of the value for the new instance of {@code Lazy}.
218     *  @param  supplier    The supplier that initialises the value for this
219     *      instance on the first call to
220     *      {@link #get()}.
221     *  @return The new instance.
222     */
223    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
224    public static <T> Lazy<T> use( final Supplier<T> supplier )
225    {
226        return new LazyImpl<>( supplier );
227    }   //  use()
228}
229//  interface Lazy
230
231/*
232 *  End of File
233 */
